conclusion: Objects A and B are in the air and will be placed down at the locations of objects C, D, E, and F. Objects C, D, E, and F are already placed on the surface.
Gravity will pull objects A and B downward until they rest on the surface or other objects, causing them to come into contact with objects C, D, E, and F.
Object A will come to rest on top of objects C and D, and object B will come to rest on top of objects E and F.
The setup after placing A and B will result in A being on top of C and D, and B being on top of E and F, causing the fabric under A and B to sag due to their weight.
The fabric sags more under A and B, indicating the weight and the contact with the objects beneath them.
The final image shows the fabric deformed by the weight of A and B resting on C, D, E, and F.
Placing objects A and B on top of C, D, E, and F will result in the fabric sagging under their combined weight.
